mdRecord.dcterms:title: Glass bottle with stopper
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Fay & Scheuler [manufacturer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Unlabeled glass bottle with dark residue inside. Embossed on bottom: "Pat'D March 6th 1894 St. Louis, Mo. F.&S." Bottle owned by August C. Camoriani (1906-1973), a pharmacist who was born and died in San Francisco. He was the owner of Rossi Drug Co. San Francisco, CA and "Mayor of North Beach" the "Little Italy" neighborhood. He served the Italian immigrant community of San Francisco for more than 40 years.
Photographed by Claude Moore Health Sciences Library, Historical Collections and Services staff.
Donated by the Estate of Eric Blum; conveyer: Harriet Nash [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: The University of Virginia Medical Artifacts Collection
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Bottles
